snippet.title: The New Bird Flu: Should You Be Worried?
snippet.description: * The New Bird Flu: Should You Be Worried? The latest virus infecting people in China has only caused deaths in people with prior illnesses, many of whom had direct contact with infected birds.

snippet.title: Proposed Experiments on Deadly Flu Virus Stir Controversy
snippet.description: * Proposed Experiments on Deadly Flu Virus Stir Controversy Two researchers are proposing genetic experiments on the H7N9 flu virus to see what would happen if it could spread from person to person.

snippet.title: A-B-C, 1-2-3: Type of Flu and Me
snippet.description: * A-B-C, 1-2-3: Type of Flu and Me Types of flu are categorized as A, B, and C. Learn about seasonal flu viruses, swine and avian flu, and how to protect yourself during flu season and pandemics.

snippet.title: 10 Worst Outbreaks in U.S. History
snippet.description: * 10 Worst Outbreaks in U.S. History Learn about the 10 worst disease outbreaks and epidemics in U.S. history, including the smallpox epidemic, cholera outbreaks, yellow fever, Spanish flu and more.

snippet.title: Bird Flu
snippet.description: * Bird Flu Overview Bird flu, also called avian influenza, is a viral infection that can also infect humans and other animals. However, most forms of the virus are restricted to birds. H5N1 is also the most common form of bird flu. Not only is it deadly to birds,...

snippet.title: FluChip shows promise in diagnosing A(H5N1) avian flu, and others including pandemic flu
snippet.description: * FluChip shows promise in diagnosing A(H5N1) avian flu, and others including pandemic flu The New York Times reports on a new test for A(H5N1) avian influenza (commonly called bird flu) which is undergoing further research. The FluChip was designed by Robert D. Kuchta and Kathy L. Rowlen, a University of Colorado chemistry professor who led...

snippet.title: Antiviral herbs
snippet.description: * Antiviral herbs Allium sativum, apple juice, Andrographis paniculata, arabinoxylan, astragalus, avian flu, bird flu, cat's claw, cloves, coenzyme Q10, cranberry, echinacea, Echinacea purpura, elderberry, forsythia, Forsythia suspense, honeysuckle, garlic, ginger, gi...

snippet.title: Deadly Bioterror Threats: Six Real Risks
snippet.description: * Deadly Bioterror Threats: Six Real Risks Healthline asks the experts about today's biggest bioterror threats.

snippet.title: Internet Helps Researchers Create Bird Flu Vaccine in Record Time
snippet.description: * Internet Helps Researchers Create Bird Flu Vaccine in Record Time The rapid flow of genetic information over the Internet has revolutionized how scientists create vaccines for emerging flu virus strains.

snippet.title: New Compounds Might Prevent Swine Flu Deaths
snippet.description: * New Compounds Might Prevent Swine Flu Deaths Some strains of the flu are more deadly than others. But a new treatment might block the chemical pathway that some strains use to kill their hosts.
